message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about friction and the properties of a concrete sidewalk. When a ball touches a concrete surface, the motion will be countered or slowed down due to abrasion. Abrasion is the process of wearing away a surface through the friction caused by rubbing or scraping. Option (B) is incorrect because lipids, which are fats, have no direct effect on the motion of a ball on a concrete sidewalk. Option (C) is also incorrect because dairy products have no influence on the motion of a ball on a concrete sidewalk. Option (D) is unrelated to the physical properties of the concrete surface.
